etymology.description: Pictogram: a variant of 大 preserving the meaning ‘man’; 大 and 夫 were once interchangeable; later also used as a jiajie (phonetic loan) for ‘that’.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a person akin to 大 with an added top stroke, later interpreted as a hairpin signifying an adult male. Meanings of 夫 and 大 diverged over time, and 夫 was also borrowed to write the demonstrative ‘that’ in Classical Chinese.

examples.chinese: 他是个好丈夫(他是個好丈夫)。
农夫在田里劳作(農夫在田裡勞作)。
examples.english: The farmer works in the field.

examples.chinese: 夫人请这边走(夫人請這邊走)。
